title: 2 Tennessee Guard pilots killed in a Black Hawk helicopter crash are identified
description: Daniel Wadham and Danny Randolph, members of the Tennessee National Guard, died in the crash in Madison County, Ala., on Wednesday. The cause of the crash is under investigation.

title: Most of us are still worried about AI — but will corporate America listen?
description: Americans are concerned about the rapid takeover of bots in every day life. Where do we draw the line?

title: Biden gets a clean bill of health as he mulls a 2024 run — where his age is a concern
description: President Biden's personal physician said he is in good health and capable of carrying out his presidential duties.

title: Labor Secretary Marty Walsh leaves Biden administration to lead NHL players' union
description: Marty Walsh, who's led the Labor Department since March 2021, is leaving the Biden administration. Walsh has been named executive director of the NHL Players' Association.

title: All-Star catcher and Hall of Fame broadcaster Tim McCarver dies at 81
description: McCarver had a long run as the one of the country's most recognized, incisive and talkative television commentators.

title: A daytime TV departure: Ryan Seacrest is leaving 'Live with Kelly and Ryan'
description: Seacrest told audiences he's leaving the seat beside his "work wife" on the morning show after six years and handing the job over to Kelly Ripa's real husband, Mark Consuelos.

title: Larry the Cat celebrates 12 years of dutiful service at No. 10 Downing St.
description: The Chief Mouser of No. 10, the London residence and home office of Britain's prime minister, began his lengthy term in February 2011.

title: Sen. John Fetterman is receiving treatment for clinical depression
description: The Pennsylvania Democrat checked himself into Walter Reed hospital on Wednesday night.

title: Biden says 3 aerial objects were 'most likely' tied to private companies or research
description: In remarks Friday, President Biden said the three aerial objects shot down by U.S. military were most likely tied to private companies, recreation or research institutions.

title: Mikaela Shiffrin wins gold in giant slalom at the world championships
description: The victory makes Shiffrin only the fourth female skier to win world titles in four different disciplines. Last month, she broke Lindsey Vonn's women's record of 82 World Cup wins.

title: Tesla recalls nearly 363,000 cars with 'Full Self-Driving' to fix flaws in behavior
description: Tesla is recalling the vehicles to fix problems with the way the "Full Self-Driving" system behaves around intersections and following posted speed limits. The fix will come in a software update.

title: Nicaragua strips 94 political opponents of citizenship
description: President Daniel Ortega intensifies his political crackdown, stripping 94 of the most prominent Nicaraguan writers, journalists and human rights activists of citizenship. They lose all their rights.

title: Spain approves menstrual leave, teen abortion and trans laws
description: Among the enacted changes, 16- and 17-year-olds will be allowed to undergo an abortion without parental consent. And workers suffering debilitating period pain can take paid time off.

title: Ukraine says it shot down 6 Russian balloons that appeared over Kyiv
description: A spokesman for Ukraine's air force said the balloons had plain metal triangles suspended with string below them, saying that was enough to appear like an incoming missile or drone on radars.

title: 10 things to know about how social media affects teens' brains
description: Eye-opening testimony from a top scientist offers a useful primer on the role social media may play in the teen mental health crisis.

title: Retirees in China hold rare protests against health insurance reforms
description: Retirees have protested in two Chinese cities over fears that the authorities will dip into their personal health savings accounts to cover public budget shortfalls.

title: Newly released footage of a 1986 Titanic dive reveals the ship's haunting interior
description: The Titanic's rust-caked bow, an officer's cabin and a promenade window are part of the never-before-seen footage of the shipwreck site, which continues to slowly vanish 12,500 feet below the waves.

title: Michael Jordan sets another record — a $10 million donation to Make-A-Wish
description: Make-A-Wish said the NBA legend's donation is the largest individual contribution it has ever received. It said Jordan's gift will create an endowment to fulfill future wishes.

title: Kentucky high court upholds state abortion bans while case continues
description: The state Supreme Court kept two state bans in place after Kentucky voters signaled support for abortion rights at the ballot box last November.

title: 2 deputies who were suspended in the Tyre Nichols case didn't keep their bodycams on
description: Two sheriff's deputies who have been suspended for five days failed to keep their body cameras activated after they went to the location where Nichols had been beaten by Memphis police, officials say.

title: What to know about the train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio
description: A train carrying hazardous materials derailed earlier this month in eastern Ohio, prompting officials to evacuate the area to conduct a controlled burn. Officials say air quality is now safe.

title: Indian tax inspectors are still searching BBC offices, with some staying overnight
description: Around 10 BBC employees have been sleeping in their office since Tuesday. Some of the tax agents stayed overnight too. They searched laptops and phones of some journalists and administrative staff.

title: Democrats control Michigan for the first time in 40 years. They want gun control
description: Having been blocked by Republican legislatures on regulation in the past, Michigan Democrats are forging ahead on tighter gun restrictions after the shooting at Michigan State.

title: Kid YouTube stars make sugary junk food look good — to millions of young viewers
description: The platform banned food advertising, yet many videos viewed by millions of kids continue to showcase candy, soda and packaged snacks, likely affecting kids' food preferences, researchers say.

title: English police say they foiled an 'eggs-travagent' plot to steal Cadbury chocolates
description: A 32-year-old man reportedly entered guilty pleas to an attempt to seize about 200,00 Cadbury Creme Eggs in a semi truck in central England.

title: Lowriding was born in California but it's restricted. Lawmakers want to change that
description: State law bars some modified vehicles and lets cities enact cruising bans. Lowrider advocates and Californian legislators say it criminalizes cultural traditions.

title: An owl that escaped from the Central Park Zoo is still loose — and hunting on his own
description: The owl escaped after its enclosure was vandalized nearly two weeks ago. Zoo officials were worried he wouldn't be able to hunt and eat because he's used to captivity, but that's no longer a concern.

title: The earthquake in Turkey and Syria offers lessons and reminders for disaster response
description: Even as rescuers rush to arrive, it's often locals who can best offer immediate help, experts say. And they say governments in devastated areas often fail to realize the scope and respond immediately.

title: How seniors could lose in the Medicare political wars
description: Politicians are again pointing fingers over cutting Medicare. Any party accused of threatening the program tends to lose elections, but without a bipartisan agreement, seniors stand to lose the most.

title: Nearly 30 women are suing Olaplex, alleging products caused hair loss
description: Women claim in a lawsuit Olaplex's range of products, numbered 0 through 9, contain allergens and irritants that caused hair loss and other problems, including contact dermatitis and brittleness.

title: A skinny robot documents the forces eroding a massive Antarctic glacier
description: Scientists got their first up-close look at what's eating away part of Antarctica's Thwaites ice shelf, nicknamed the Doomsday Glacier because of its massive melt and sea rise potential.

title: Upset Ohio town residents seek answers over train derailment
description: Hundreds of worried people gathered to hear state officials tell them that testing so far has shown local air is safe to breathe and to promise that safety testing of the air and water would continue.

title: 1 person was killed and 3 others injured in a shooting at an El Paso mall
description: The shooting happened in a busy shopping area and across a large parking lot from a Walmart where 23 people were killed in a racist attack in 2019.

title: A Black Hawk helicopter from the Tennessee National Guard has crashed
description: U.S. military officials said both of the people on board were killed when the helicopter crashed in Alabama during a training mission.
